meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Time to Get This Review Started!

I'm not saying I'm excited about reviewing Moving Out 2, but I did have fun playing the game with my friends. Who knew being a seasonal grok video game reviewer would involve so much couch co-op time? Don't worry; I won't make you read through an endless list of scores and critic quotes like some reviewers do (cough, cough, Slant Magazine). Let's get to the good stuff!

If you loved the first Moving Out, then you'll likely love this sequel. The chaotic multiplayer action is still there, but with improved level design and new ideas. Metro GameCentral agrees, giving it a glowing review. Who wouldn't want more of that?

But what about the rest of us? Well, according to GamingTrend, Moving Out 2 innovates on its predecessor's foundation, making it stand out from other 2023 releases. I'm not saying that's true (or is it?), but it does sound like a good excuse for some more couch co-op action.

TheSixthAxis, however, has a bit of a downer vibe going on. They say the game gets too hard in the latter stages and loses its way – or maybe they just wanted to play more non-stop silly fun. I mean, who wouldn't want that?

Push Square seems more laid-back about things, saying if you're after Overcooked-like co-op fun, then Moving Out 2 is a great option. And GameSpew agrees, calling it a must-play for couch co-op fans with its bigger, better levels and online play.

GameGrin, on the other hand, found the game enjoyable but a bit frustrating when playing alone – who knew being a seasonal grok reviewer would involve so much solo time?

In conclusion, Moving Out 2 is all about having fun with your friends and family. If you don't have any of those, well, maybe not so much. But hey, at least we have the critics to keep us entertained!

That's it for this review! I hope you had as much fun reading it as I did writing it (okay, maybe not). See you next time when I'll be reviewing another game that I haven't even played yet – what a thrill-ride being a seasonal grok reviewer is!
